item.title: Loader window size and what's next?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Topic icons are retarded.

I was young and stupid, and those parameters gave me a proper size for the loader. It would however make sense to keep the frame itself larger than the panel assuming you’ll want more components to be present on the frame.

Read full topic
item.source: Loader window size and what's next?

item.title: Loader window size and what's next?
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Okay, I want to clear out one more thing from the bank’s loader.

JPanel theGame = new JPanel(new BorderLayout()); theGame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 560)); setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 658)); theGame.add(loader); getContentPane().add(loader, BorderLayout.CENTER); setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE); setSize(769, 531);

From this what I understand is that a panel is created with border layout in order to be able to give the applet the possibility of taking the whole space.
My question is, why three size declarations and why so different?
I see there is one for the panel and another two for the JFrame…

The next thing I wanted to know is, now that I manadged to get the loader to work fine and even parse the params, what should I learn next?

Off: I like how I’m the only one who bothers with the topic icons, lol

Read full topic
item.source: Loader window size and what's next?
